alert.note: Alert for Somervell; Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 4:33AM CST until December 25 at 6:30PM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Bosque, Hood, Johnson, Parker, Somervell and Tarrant counties in North Texas. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Worth, Arlington, Euless, Bedford, Grapevine, Haltom City, Keller, Hurst, Burleson, Cleburne, Southlake, Weatherford, Watauga, Colleyville, Benbrook, Saginaw, White Settlement, Crowley, Forest Hill and Azle.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
